document_data.name: Zita
document_data.mainbody:
'''Zita''' was a laborer and a packer of the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette'' in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|''Between you and me â€“ I don't even read 'em. Quality of reporting is arse these days.''|Zita}}
document_data.Description: Zita was an older, pale-skinned [[gold dwarf]] with a clean-shaved face. She had gray hair gathered in a braid and affixed around her head and blue eyes. Zita wore a loose white [[tunic]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, during the [[Absolute crisis]], Zita was employed by Baldur's Mouth and could be found outside the [[broadsheet]] publisher's office backing issues for delivery. She personally stopped reading the paper due to the sharply declined quality of reporting and [[Lord Gortash]]'s propaganda. She also was used to hearing complaints about the broadsheet's contents and simply sent everyone into the offices to talk to the editor-in-chief instead.
